txt.en: 'Stay behind me, Master Halfling.'
'He sends a servant to us. A messenger only.'
The Mouth of Sauron smiles with cruelty and avarice
On the very doorstep of Mordor, Aragorn commands Sauron to come forth and surrender.
'Someone comes!'
'Saruman?'
Stand with Aragorn as he defies the Dark Lord Sauron
Stand with Aragorn as he defies the Mouth of Sauron
Talk to Pippin and keep him quiet
Listen to the demands of the Mouth of Sauron
Talk to Mithrandir
Collect the short-sword
Collect the Elf-cloak
Collect the mithril-shirt
Mithrandir asked you to retrieve the items presented by the Mouth of Sauron.
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
'Why isn't anything happening?'
'Is that... is that the Dark Lord?'
'Oh no!'
Talk to Aragorn outside the Black Gate
'But why bring them here?'
'Name these terms.'
'This is much to exchange for the delivery of one prisoner.'
DNT - Blah!
'Has Sauron's defeat on the field of battle so demoralized him that now he must haggle?'
'Where is this prisoner? Deliver him to us and we will consider Sauron's terms.'
'[placeholder], I would speak with you.'
'Now, [placeholder]!'
'We take these items in memory of our friend!'
'As for your terms, consider them utterly rejected!'
'We did not come here to waste words with Sauron, or with his slaves.'
You have taken the items that belonged to Frodo and Sam, and Gandalf has defied the Mouth of Sauron.

'All is still and silent, but I do not trust this emptiness. Do not be fooled by the quiet! There are eyes upon us, though we see them not.\n\n'Let us ride nearer, and I will call for Sauron's surrender.'

'Steel your heart for the trials ahead, [placeholder]. That Sauron has either Frodo or Samwise in captivity seems certain, but you must have noticed, as I have, that this Messenger speaks only of one prisoner, not of two.\n\n'And yet, those items are unmistakable and were in the possession of both our hobbits. I do not want this vile Messenger to keep them. I will distract him, [placeholder], and I want you to retrieve these items in memory of our friends.'

'[placeholder]! Surely you must recognize those items! That's Frodo's mail-shirt, the one he had from Bilbo! The grey cloak has an elven-brooch pinned to it, like the one I had from LÃ³rien. And that's Sam's sword, or I'm a Boffin!

'How did this terrible Messenger come to have those items, [placeholder]? What happened to Frodo and Sam?'

You silence Pippin with a look, but he is crestfallen and his outburst cannot be taken back.
'Your protection as a herald is near its end, and death is close at hand for you!'
'Now begone!'
'DNT - Blah!'
Stand with the Host of the West in defiance of Mordor
'We go now to treat with Mordor.'
'I have asked all of you to accompany me so every land that opposes Sauron will be represented.'
'It is time.'
'This is far enough.'
'Unfurl the banner. Let them see with whom they are dealing.'
'Hearken to me!'
'Gondor has come to your border with just grievances and fair demands!'
'Send forth the Lord of the Black Land!'
'Wrongfully has he made war upon Gondor, and taken its lands.'
'Let him come forth to answer for these crimes!'
'As King of Gondor, I demand that Sauron come forth and atone for his evils!'
'He speaks of himself.'
'Well-spoken, my friend.'
'Now we will see what answer Sauron will make.'
Instance: The Black Gate
'I am the Mouth of Sauron, and I speak for He who resides in the Dark Tower.'
Aragorn is at the Morannon, the Black Gate of Mordor, and prepares to challenge Sauron.
'Steady, Master Peregrin.'
'I see none who have authority to treat with me.'
'No. Sauron will not leave his lands until his victory is assured.'
'Certainly not thou!'
Aragorn has decided to call for the surrender of Sauron, and wishes for you to stand with him.
'I am not to be touched! I am protected as a herald!'
'Indeed, but we would be wise not to underestimate this messenger.'
The Mouth of Sauron has presented tokens for the perusal of the company.
'He must be deep in the Enemy's counsels to be trusted with this message.'
'We are surprised to see thee with this rabble, old greybeard.'
Mithrandir has asked you to make Pippin hold his tongue lest he endanger the negotiations with the Mouth of Sauron.
'You have nothing to fear from us, Messenger, until your errand is done.'
'Dost thou not sendst others to their doom, hatching thy plots from a safe distance?'
'But if your Master does not repent of his evil, you will be imperiled indeed.'
'I have tokens I was bidden to show thee, if thou shouldst dare to come.'
The Mouth of Sauron mocks the Host of the West, and prepares the terms of Aragorn's surrender. Remain alert.
'Quiet, Peregrin!'
'You have another of these imps with you!'
Mithrandir has asked for you to speak with him while he considers Sauron's terms.
'[placeholder], see to him and tell him to hold his tongue!'
'I do not know what use you find in them.'
'I do not seek to deny them. I know all their history, which you do not.'
'Sending them as spies into Mordor is foolish, even for you.'
'But this imp does me a service, and I thank him for it.'
'You cannot deny these tokens now, for he plainly has seen them before.'
'Coat of the dwarves... cloak of the Elves... blade of the fallen West...'
'And spy from the Shire, home to rats. Aye, we know of it.'
'He who bore these tokens might be dear to you, and he might not.'
'But if you would grieve to lose him, I advise you to think most carefully.'
'Sauron bears no love for spies. His fate will depend on your choice.'
'Good! I can see he was dear to you.'
'Or maybe his errand was one you did not want to fail?'
'It has.'
'Now your little spy will suffer the worst torments the Dark Tower can devise.'
'You will never see him again. Or, perhaps, he will be released when he is broken.'
'And he will come to you thus changed, and you will see what you have done.'
'This is what will be, unless you accept my Lord's terms.'
'Gondor's rabble will withdraw beyond the River Anduin.'
'They will take oaths to never again assail Sauron the Great or his subjects.'
'All lands east of the Anduin will be Sauron's in perpetuity.'
'Lands west of the Anduin will be subordinate to his will.'
'The men of those lands will arrange their own affairs, but bear no weapons.'
'They will help to rebuild Isengard, and Sauron's lieutenant will dwell there.'
'He will rule over the remains of the West.'
'Nay, not Saruman.'
'Insolence! You are in no position to make demands of Sauron!'
'These are the terms. You will take them, or you will leave them!'
'Ssssss!'
